page.title: 02Local History of MayHill
page.content: {MayHill}is formed of sandstone & its summit is reached on footpaths which mark the area .MayHill was originally known as{Yartleton}Hill,being owned by people from several parishes,but became known as MayHill because by custom people gathered on May 1st to fight for possession of the hill.The local Morris Men come to greet MayDay by dancing at dawn on MayHill.{Legend} says there are only 99 trees in the clump at the summit but in reality there are over 200 trees having been planted in their present clump to celebrate{Queen Victoria's Golden } {Jubilee}.The area around the summit now belongs to Longhope Parish Council while the surrounding land is the property of the National Trust.
